segment.source: Welcome to WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground
segment.target: Welcome to WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground

segment.source: We are happy to announce the arrival of the WDG CPub Playground.
segment.target: We are happy to announce the arrival of the WDG CPub Playground.

segment.source: Git logo
segment.target: Git logo

segment.source: Markdown logo
segment.target: Markdown logo

segment.source: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content, and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.
segment.target: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content, and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.

segment.source: If you are already familiar with GitHub, are part of the Microsoft organization, and want to dive right in, skip down to the "Set up your personal playground" section.
segment.target: If you are already familiar with GitHub, are part of the Microsoft organization, and want to dive right in, skip down to the "Set up your personal playground" section.

segment.source: If you see anything in this topic that is no longer correct or that just bothers you in some way you can't really explain, please fix it by submitting a pull request with the changes.
segment.target: If you see anything in this topic that is no longer correct or that just bothers you in some way you can't really explain, please fix it by submitting a pull request with the changes.

segment.source: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization
segment.target: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization

segment.source: There are two main steps in getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub: creating a GitHub account and then connecting it to the Microsoft organization.
segment.target: There are two main steps in getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub: creating a GitHub account and then connecting it to the Microsoft organization.

segment.source: If you already have a GitHub account you want to use, you can skip the first step.
segment.target: If you already have a GitHub account you want to use, you can skip the first step.

segment.source: Sign up for GitHub -- Go to https://github.com/ and sign up as a new user.
segment.target: Sign up for GitHub -- Go to https://github.com/ and sign up as a new user.

segment.source: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.
segment.target: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.

segment.source: Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization -- For this step, follow the instructions found at https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service.
segment.target: Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization -- For this step, follow the instructions found at https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service.

segment.source: Note: Open Source Hub (https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com) is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.
segment.target: Note: Open Source Hub (https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com) is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.

segment.source: Set up your own personal playground
segment.target: Set up your own personal playground

segment.source: To use the WDG CPub sandbox, all you need to do is:
segment.target: To use the WDG CPub sandbox, all you need to do is:

segment.source: Create folder as a child of .
segment.target: Create folder as a child of .

segment.source: Start marking down!
segment.target: Start marking down!

segment.source: As needed, add any topics you'd like to the file to incorporate into the TOC.
segment.target: As needed, add any topics you'd like to the file to incorporate into the TOC.

segment.source: The TOC uses markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.) to designate levels.
segment.target: The TOC uses markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.) to designate levels.

segment.source: Learn more...
segment.target: Learn more...

segment.source: This section provides resources for learning more about using Open Publishing, Git, and markdown.
segment.target: This section provides resources for learning more about using Open Publishing, Git, and markdown.

segment.source: ...about Open Publishing
segment.target: ...about Open Publishing

segment.source: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP or OPS) has its own set of documentation at https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction.
segment.target: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP or OPS) has its own set of documentation at https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction.

segment.source: Be sure to check out the documentation on performing local builds to see how you can preview your content locally and publish to stage simply by pushing to the master.
segment.target: Be sure to check out the documentation on performing local builds to see how you can preview your content locally and publish to stage simply by pushing to the master.

segment.source: ...about Git
segment.target: ...about Git

segment.source: There are many resources on using Git out there.
segment.target: There are many resources on using Git out there.

segment.source: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub on GitHub itself (see the home page).
segment.target: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub on GitHub itself (see the home page).

segment.source: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:
segment.target: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:

segment.source: Pro Git online book -- http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2
segment.target: Pro Git online book -- http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2

segment.source: Online Git tutorial -- http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/
segment.target: Online Git tutorial -- http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/

segment.source: Git guided tour -- http://githowto.com/
segment.target: Git guided tour -- http://githowto.com/

segment.source: Blog post on Git best practices -- http://sethrobertson.github.io/GitBestPractices/
segment.target: Blog post on Git best practices -- http://sethrobertson.github.io/GitBestPractices/

segment.source: Tutorial on Git branching -- http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/
segment.target: Tutorial on Git branching -- http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/

segment.source: ...about markdown
segment.target: ...about markdown

segment.source: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is Daring Fireball.
segment.target: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is Daring Fireball.

segment.source: Choosing the right tools
segment.target: Choosing the right tools

segment.source: WDG CPub currently doesn't provide any specific recommendation around which tools you should use for doing markdown authoring and interacting with the repo.
segment.target: WDG CPub currently doesn't provide any specific recommendation around which tools you should use for doing markdown authoring and interacting with the repo.

segment.source: What follows are some options that some have recommended over the past year of various pilot projects.
segment.target: What follows are some options that some have recommended over the past year of various pilot projects.

segment.source: If you come across a tool that you think works better, please add it here and tell us why it works so well.
segment.target: If you come across a tool that you think works better, please add it here and tell us why it works so well.

segment.source: Markdown editing
segment.target: Markdown editing

segment.source: VS Code -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).
segment.target: VS Code -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).

segment.source: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.
segment.target: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.

segment.source: MarkdownPad Pro -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.
segment.target: MarkdownPad Pro -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.

segment.source: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).
segment.target: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).

segment.source: Atom -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.
segment.target: Atom -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.

segment.source: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.
segment.target: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.

segment.source: Notepad -- For the lover of simplicity.
segment.target: Notepad -- For the lover of simplicity.

segment.source: Visual Studio -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.
segment.target: Visual Studio -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.

segment.source: The Web Essentialls plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.
segment.target: The Web Essentialls plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.

segment.source: Git management
segment.target: Git management

segment.source: GitHub -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.
segment.target: GitHub -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.

segment.source: GitHub Desktop -- Allows you to manage different repos and handle merge conflicts.
segment.target: GitHub Desktop -- Allows you to manage different repos and handle merge conflicts.

segment.source: Tortoise Git -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.
segment.target: Tortoise Git -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.

segment.source: SourceTree -- Git management through a GUI; more straightforward than GitHub Desktop, this is recommended for those who prefer not to use a command-line interface.
segment.target: SourceTree -- Git management through a GUI; more straightforward than GitHub Desktop, this is recommended for those who prefer not to use a command-line interface.

segment.source: (Note: Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions here.)
segment.target: (Note: Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions here.)

segment.source: PoshGit -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.
segment.target: PoshGit -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.

segment.source: PowerShell lovers, this is the one for you.
segment.target: PowerShell lovers, this is the one for you.

segment.source: Git-Scm -- Git on the command line.
segment.target: Git-Scm -- Git on the command line.

segment.source: Get yourself some markdown in Emacs (which does exist), and you're kicking it old school.
segment.target: Get yourself some markdown in Emacs (which does exist), and you're kicking it old school.

segment.source: Visual Studio/VS Code -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.
segment.target: Visual Studio/VS Code -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.

segment.source: VS2015 also has GitHub repo integration straight out of the box.
segment.target: VS2015 also has GitHub repo integration straight out of the box.

segment.source: Tips and Tricks
segment.target: Tips and Tricks

segment.source: This section is intended for random links to items of interest:
segment.target: This section is intended for random links to items of interest:

segment.source: Command line phobic?
segment.target: Command line phobic?

segment.source: Check out Recommended tools for beginners for a recommendation on how to get started.
segment.target: Check out Recommended tools for beginners for a recommendation on how to get started.

segment.source: See Ted Hudek's tips for converting WDCML to markdown and his crowd-pleasing markdown tips.
segment.target: See Ted Hudek's tips for converting WDCML to markdown and his crowd-pleasing markdown tips.

segment.source: Don Marshall has put together instructions for editing content through the GitHub UI which can be a very painless way to make quick updates.
segment.target: Don Marshall has put together instructions for editing content through the GitHub UI which can be a very painless way to make quick updates.
